pages.text: After some research, you've found a way to create a more powerful and versatile version of the $(l:intro/cursed_cage)Cursed Cage$(). The Arca will store and distribute your Soul Energy making it so you won't need to use or carry a Totem of Souls anymore.
The Arca is one of the toughest blocks you have encountered, with the preservation of water and extra Obsidian, it's strength and Explosive Resistance is beyond most materials besides Bedrock.

When you place down an Arca, the Arca will see you as its owner. As the owner, you can instantly break your Arca by right-clicking on it while crouching, which is quite handy considering how hard it is. Also, the Arca now holds all Soul Energy the owner collects and use, and will override any Totem of Souls the Owner has.
Due to this, one should use $(l:crafts/soul_transfer_gem)Transfer Gems$() to power one's Cursed Cages as trying to fill up a Totem with an Arca can be a tricky process.
Runes shows which Arca is being used.

You can only have ONE Arca, placing another will cause the new Arca to replace the former. If the Arca is broken, the Soul Energy stored within will slowly evaporate, causing Soul Hunger, which weakens and slows you down, until all the Energy is gone or another Arca is placed. If there are multiple Arcas, right clicking an unused one with an empty hand will transfer which Arca is being used.
